azureLogAnalytics.query:
//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

AppExceptions 
| where TimeGenerated >= $__timeFrom() and TimeGenerated <= $__timeTo()
| extend outerMessageStr = replace_string(OuterMessage, "\r\n", "")
| extend Error = case(outerMessageStr contains "Errors", extract("\\\"Errors\\\": \\[( )*\\\"(.+)\\\"", 2, outerMessageStr), outerMessageStr )
| summarize count() by Error, AppRoleName 
| order by count_

AzureMetrics                                                              
| where TimeGenerated >= $__timeFrom() and TimeGenerated <= $__timeTo()                                   
| extend timeBin = bin(TimeGenerated, 5m) 
| summarize ResponseTime = sumif(Average, MetricName=="requests/duration") by timeBin, Resource, bin(TimeGenerated, 1h) 
| project TimeGenerated, Resource, ResponseTime

| sort by TimeGenerated asc

AzureMetrics                                                              
| where TimeGenerated >= $__timeFrom() and TimeGenerated <= $__timeTo()                                   
| extend timeBin = bin(TimeGenerated, 5m) 
| summarize ResponseTime = sumif(Average, MetricName=="requests/duration") by timeBin, Resource, bin(TimeGenerated, 1h) 
| project TimeGenerated, Resource, ResponseTime

| sort by TimeGenerated asc

AppRequests
| where TimeGenerated >= $__timeFrom() and TimeGenerated <= $__timeTo()
| where Name !in ("GET /probe.html", "GET /favicon.ico", "HEAD /")
| summarize count() by Name, AppRoleName
| order by count_

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

azureResourceGraph.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.web/certificates"
| where name == "{primaryManagedCertName}"
| project daysLeft = datetime_diff("day", todatetime(properties.expirationDate), now())

azureResourceGraph.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.web/certificates"
| where name == "{secondaryManagedCertName}"
| project daysLeft = datetime_diff("day", todatetime(properties.expirationDate), now())
